com.escape.games.view
Class GameplayFragment

java.lang.Object
  android.app.Fragment
      com.escape.games.view.GameplayFragment
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, TaskChannel
public abstract class GameplayFragment
extends android.app.Fragment
implements TaskChannel

Basic gameplay fragment. Create subclass and override abstract methods.

Author:
escape-llc

Constructor Detail

GameplayFragment

Method Detail

createGame

protected abstract GameCycle createGame(GLSurfaceViewImpl glsv,
                                        TaskChannel tc)
Create the game instance and connect it to this as supervisor.

Parameters:
glsv - surface view.
tc - Supervisor task channel; must pass this as the supervisor parameter to your GameCycle ctor!
Returns:
new instance.

setupContentView

protected void setupContentView(android.view.View root,
                                int viewid)
Must call this within Fragment.createContentView(). Sets these view properties programmatically: KeepScreenOn:true, FocusableInTouchMode:true, Focusable:true. If the GL surface view is found, calls createGame() to get the game instance and start game task.

Parameters:
root - Root view of fragment.
viewid - GL Surface View ID.

isInstanceRestartable

protected boolean isInstanceRestartable()
Whether the GameCycle instance is restartable for each game, or whether a new instance must be created.

Returns:
false: not restartable.

send

public void send(TaskMessage tm)
          throws java.lang.Exception
Process supervisor callbacks from the GameCycle.

Specified by:
send in interface TaskChannel
Parameters:
tm - Message to send.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Target cannot receive messages (e.g. thread not alive).

postStartGame

protected void postStartGame(int delay)
Invoke-safe. Post a runnable to send start-game.

Parameters:
delay - Post delay in MS.

postToggleGame

protected void postToggleGame(int delay)
Invoke-safe. Post a runnable to send toggle-game.

Parameters:
delay - Post delay in MS.

postPauseGame

protected void postPauseGame(int delay)
Invoke-safe. Post a runnable to send pause-game.

Parameters:

isGameRunning

public boolean isGameRunning()
Is the game engine thread created and alive?

Returns:
true: running; false: not running.

isGamePlaying

public boolean isGamePlaying()
Is the game engine thread created, alive, and playing the game (started and not over)?

Returns:
true: playing; false: not playing.
